attributes.action: reduce working week from 5 to 4 days with same pay, same hours.
attributes.additional_details: heavy workloads, as well as work-related stress and anxiety, are costing our public services as well as private companies millions each year, with one in four of all sick days being lost as a direct result of workload pressures.shorter working weeks (and greater worker control over working time) can mean fewer sick absences, fewer in-work accidents and higher motivation on the job. Working fewer hours can be good for business too, and could relieve some strain on our public health services.
attributes.background: 5day week at 35hrs isn't something that is beneficial in todays society changes in recent years through technology causing many job loss. By changing to a 4 day week (reduced hours at same pay) this will result to Higher productivity, Lower stress, Employee satisfaction.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because it's about something that the UK Government and Parliament are not responsible for. This would be a decision for employers.

UK and EU law places limits on the total amount of time someone can work during a week and the minimum amount they can be paid an hour, but it doesn't specify how many or which days of the week they have to work.

You could start a new petition calling for a law placing limits on the number of days someone is allowed to work during a week if that is something you would like to see happen.
